file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-32-01-04 - CD PLAYER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CD PLAYER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the CD player. B. The CD player is installed in the forward galley, zone 232. C. To do these procedures, use AMM TASK 23-32-01-000-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 23-32-01-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 23-32-01-000-802-A/400 and AMM TASK 23-32-01-400-802-A/400 or AMM TASK 23-32-01-000-803-A/400 and AMM TASK 23-32-01-400-803-A/400, as applicable. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-000-801-A CD PLAYER - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-400-801-A CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-000-802-A CD PLAYER - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-400-802-A CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-000-803-A CD PLAYER - REMOVAL EMB-145 ACFT MODEL(S) 23-32-01-400-803-A CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION EMB-145 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 1 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. CD PLAYER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the removal of the CD player. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley H. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-006-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers listed below and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) Remove the screws (2) that attach the door (3) to the forward galley (1). (3) Remove the door (3). (4) Pull and hold the table lock (10). (5) Pull the table (7) and remove it from the forward galley (1). (6) Remove the shroud (8) to get access to the screw (17). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 2 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-006-A (1) Remove the screw (17) that attaches the CD player compartment (6) to the forward galley (1). (2) Open the door (12) to get access to the screw (13). (3) Remove the screw (13) that attaches the CD player compartment (6) to the forward galley (1). (4) Remove the screws (5) and washers (4). (5) Carefully pull the CD player compartment (6) to get access to the audio connector (15) and electrical connector (14). (6) Disconnect the audio connector (15) and the electrical connector (14). (7) Remove the screws (16) that attach the trim frame (11) to the CD player compartment (6). (8) Remove the trim frame (11). (9) Remove the CD player (9) from the CD player compartment (6). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 3 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 CD Player - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 232 DET. A 2. SCREW (3) 1. FORWARD GALLEY 3. DOOR 4. WASHER (3) 5. SCREW (3) 6. CD PLAYER 7. TABLE COMPARTMENT C 8. SHROUD 9. CD PLAYER 10. TABLE 17. SCREW LOCK 16. SCREW (5) 15. AUDIO CONNECTOR VIEW C 14. ELECTRICAL 11. TRIM FRAME CONNECTOR 13. SCREW 12. DOOR DET. B 145AMM230192.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 4 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the installation of the CD player. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-801-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-804-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-006-A (1) Put the CD player (9) into the CD player compartment (6). (2) Put the trim frame (11) in position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 5 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the screws (16) that attach the trim frame (11) to the CD player compartment (6). (4) Connect the audio connector (15) and the electrical connector (14). (5) Carefully, put the CD player compartment (6) into the forward galley (1). (6) Install the screws (5) and washers (4) that attach the CD player compartment (6) to the forward galley (1). (7) Install the screw (13). (8) Close the door (12). (9) Install the screw (17). J. Follow-on (Figure 401) SUBTASK 842-006-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers listed below and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-245) Do the CD player model DEH-245 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-801-A/500). (3) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1000) Do the CD player model DEH-1000 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-804-A/500). (4) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1400) Do the CD player model DEH-1400 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500). (5) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1600) Do the CD player model DEH-1600 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500). (6) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1700) Do the CD player model DEH-1700 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500). (7) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1800) Do the CD player model DEH-1800 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500). (8) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1900) Do the CD player model DEH-1900 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500). (9) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1300) Do the CD player model DEH-1300 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500). (10) Put the shroud (8) in position. (11) Pull and hold the table lock (10). (12) Put the table (7) into the forward galley (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 6 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (13) Put the door (3) in position in the forward galley (1). (14) Install the screws (2) that attach the door (3) to the forward galley (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 7 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 4. CD PLAYER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the removal of the CD player. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley H. Preparation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 841-007-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers listed below and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). I. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-007-A (1) Open the door (11) to get access to the screws (3) and washers (2). (2) Remove the screws (3) and washers (2) that attach the CD player compartment (5) to the forward galley (1). (3) Remove the screws (10) that attach the CD player compartment (5) to the forward galley (1). (4) Carefully pull the CD player compartment (5) to get access to the audio connector (9) and electrical connector (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 8 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Disconnect the audio connector (9) and the electrical connector (8). (6) Remove the screws (4) that attach the trim frame (6) to the CD player compartment (5). (7) Remove the trim frame (6). (8) Remove the CD player (7) from the CD player compartment (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 9 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 CD Player - Removal/Installation Figure 402 ZONE B 232 A B 1. FORWARD GALLEY DET. A 2. WASHER (2) 3. SCREW (2) 4. SCREW (5) 5. CD PLAYER COMPARTMENT 6. TRIM FRAME 10. SCREW (2) 11. DOOR 9. AUDIO CONNECTOR DET. B 8. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 7. CD PLAYER 145AMM230193.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 10 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 5. CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the installation of the CD player. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-801-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-804-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-007-A (1) Carefully, put the CD player (7) into the CD player compartment (5). (2) Put the trim frame (6) in position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 11 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the screws (4) that attach the trim frame (6) to the CD player compartment (5). (4) Connect the audio connector (9) and the electrical connector (8). (5) Carefully, put the CD player compartment (5) into the forward galley (1). (6) Install the screws (3) and washers (2) that attach the CD player compartment (5) to the forward galley (1). (7) Install the screws (10) that attach the CD player compartment (5) to the forward galley (1). J. Follow-on (Figure 402) SUBTASK 842-007-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers listed below and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-245) Do the CD player model DEH-245 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-801-A/500). (3) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1000) Do the CD player model DEH-1000 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-804-A/500). (4) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1400) Do the CD player model DEH-1400 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500). (5) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1600) Do the CD player model DEH-1600 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500). (6) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1700) Do the CD player model DEH-1700 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500). (7) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1800) Do the CD player model DEH-1800 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500). (8) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1900) Do the CD player model DEH-1900 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500). (9) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1300) Do the CD player model DEH-1300 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500). (10) Close the door (11). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 12 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-000-803-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 6. CD PLAYER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the removal of the CD player. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 26-14-02-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley I. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-008-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) Remove the screw (5) and washer (6) that attach the support (4) to the forward galley (1). (3) Remove the support (4). (4) Carefully remove the shroud (14). (5) Open the door (16). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 13 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (6) Pull the waste container (15) and remove it from the forward galley (1). (7) Open the door (18) to get access to the Smoke Detector Panel (7). (8) Remove the Smoke Detector Panel (7) (AMM TASK 26-14-02-000-801-A/400). (9) Remove the screws (2) that attach the magnetic catch (3) to the forward galley (1). (10) Remove the magnetic catch (3). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-008-A (1) Remove the screws (17) that attach the CD player compartment (9) to the forward galley (1). (2) Carefully pull the CD player compartment (9) to get access to the audio connector (10) and electrical connector (11). (3) Disconnect the audio connector (10) and the electrical connector (11). (4) Remove the screws (8) that attach the trim frame (13) to the CD player compartment (9). (5) Remove the trim frame (13). (6) Remove the CD player (12) from the CD player compartment (9). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 14 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

MAGNETIC CATCH DET. A ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (REF.) 7. SMOKE DETECTOR SCREW (4) (REF.) 18. DOOR 8. SCREW (4) 9. CD PLAYER COMPARTMENT 10. AUDIO CONNECTOR 11. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 12. CD PLAYER 17. SCREW (4) 13. TRIM FACE 15. WASTE CONTAINER 14. SHROUD 16. DOOR DET. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-32-01-400-803-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 7. CD PLAYER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures for the installation of the CD player. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-802-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-805-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500 - AMM TASK 26-14-02-400-801-A/400 - TASK 23-32-01-700-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 Forward galley D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward galley I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-008-A (1) Open the door (18). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 16 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Carefully, put the CD player (12) into the CD player compartment (9). (3) Put the trim frame (13) in position. (4) Install the screws (8) that attach the trim frame (13) to the CD player compartment (9). (5) Connect the audio connector (10) and the electrical connector (11). (6) Carefully, put the CD player compartment (9) into the forward galley (1). (7) Install the screws (17) that attach the CD player compartment (9) to the forward galley (1). J. Follow-on (Figure 401) SUBTASK 842-008-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • MUSIC (Location Tip: SHED DC BUS 1/SERVICE/MUSIC). • PA (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) Do the CD player operational test (TASK 23-32-01-700-802-A). (3) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-245) Do the CD player model DEH-245 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-802-A/500). (4) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1000) Do the CD player model DEH-1000 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-805-A/500). (5) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1400) Do the CD player model DEH-1400 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-808-A/500). (6) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1600) Do the CD player model DEH-1600 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-809-A/500). (7) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1700) Do the CD player model DEH-1700 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-810-A/500). (8) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1800) Do the CD player model DEH-1800 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-811-A/500). (9) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1900) Do the CD player model DEH-1900 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-812-A/500). (10) (Aircraft with CD player model DEH-1300) Do the CD player model DEH-1300 operational test (AMM TASK 23-32-00-700-813-A/500). (11) Put the magnetic catch (3) in position. (12) Install the screws (2). (13) Put the waste container (15) into the forward galley (1). (14) Close the door (16). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 17 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (15) Put the shroud (14) in position. (16) Put the support (4) in position. (17) Install the screws (5) and washers (6) that attach the support (4) to the forward galley (1). (18) Install the Smoke Detector Panel (7) (AMM TASK 26-14-02-400-801-A/400). (19) Close the door (18). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-1 23-32-01 Page 18 of 18 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
